abstract.text: Invalidates glyph and layout information for a portion of the text in the given text storage object.

instead.

inlineContent.text: The text storage whose information is invalidated.
Specifies the nature of the changes. Its value is made by combining with the C bitwise OR operator the constants described in “Change notifications” in
and
Indicates the extent of characters resulting from the edits.
If the
bit of
is set, gives the number of characters added to or removed from the original range (otherwise its value is irrelevant).
Represents the range of characters affected after attributes have been fixed. Is either equal to
or larger. For example, deleting a paragraph separator character invalidates the layout information for all characters in the paragraphs that precede and follow the separator.
This message is sent from the
object’s
method to indicate that its characters or attributes have changed. This method invalidates glyphs and layout for the affected characters.
For example, after replacing “The” with “Several” to produce the string “Several files couldn’t be saved”,
is {0, 7} and
is 4. The receiver uses this information to update its character-to-glyph mapping and to update the selection range based on the change.
The
messages are sent in a series to each
object associated with the text storage object, so the layout managers receiving them shouldn’t edit
while this method is executing. If one of them does, the
, and
arguments are incorrect for all following layout managers that receive the message.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An object that coordinates the layout and display of text characters.
Deletes the glyphs in the given range from the receiver’s glyph store.
Fills the passed-in buffer with a sequence of glyphs.
Returns the glyphs and information needed to perform layout for the given glyph range.
Returns the glyphs and information needed to perform layout for the given glyph range.
Returns the glyph at the specified index.
Returns the glyph at a specified index, and optionally returns a flag indicating whether the requested index is valid.
Inserts a single glyph into the glyph stream at the given index and maps it to the character at the given character index.
Inserts the given glyphs into the glyph cache at the given index and maps them to characters beginning at the given character index.
Returns the value of the attribute identified by the given attribute tag for the glyph at the given index.
Specifies explicitly when portions of the glyph stream depend on layout.
Invalidates the layout information for the glyphs mapped to the given range of characters.
Notifies the layout manager when an edit action changes the contents of its text storage object.
Replaces the glyph at the given index with a new glyph.
Sets the index of the character corresponding to the glyph at the given glyph index.
Sets a custom attribute value for a given glyph.
Renders the glyphs at the specified positions, using the specified attributes.
Invalidates glyph and layout information for a portion of the text in the given text storage object.
The fundamental storage mechanism of TextKit that contains the text managed by the system.
Cleans up changes to the text storage object and notifies its delegate and layout managers of changes.
Attributes were added, removed, or changed.
Characters were added, removed, or replaced.
** Deprecations ***
A Swift-only concrete structure that backs the range type alias.
Describes an integer.
A signed integer value type.
